description:
Currently, the LightRay analysis module only accepts the filename of datasets, which it loads into memory to create the rays.  This PR adds the ability for LightRay to accept datasets already loaded into memory like most other data object classes.

I also added tests, updated the docstrings, and updated a cookbook recipe to reflect these changes.

UPDATE1:  Accounting for the suggestions from @brittonsmith and @xarthisius .  Thanks for catching those problems!
title: Enabling LightRay to accept loaded datasets instead of just filenames

pullrequest.title: Enabling LightRay to accept loaded datasets instead of just filenames

content.raw: It's confusing here to say "path and filename."  It suggests that you need to provide two things.  I would just say pass the filename.
content.html: It's confusing here to say "path and filename." It suggests that you need to provide two things. I would just say pass the filename.

pullrequest.title: Enabling LightRay to accept loaded datasets instead of just filenames

content.raw: I don't think we're supposed to import from yt within the source.  I would change this to `from yt.convenience import load`.
content.html: I don't think we're supposed to import from yt within the source. I would change this to from yt.convenience import load.

pullrequest.title: Enabling LightRay to accept loaded datasets instead of just filenames

content.raw: Other than minor comments, this looks good to me.  Thanks for adding tests!
content.html: Other than minor comments, this looks good to me. Thanks for adding tests!

pullrequest.title: Enabling LightRay to accept loaded datasets instead of just filenames

content.raw: Even better: use `from yt.utilities.answer_testing.framework import data_dir_load`
content.html: Even better: use from yt.utilities.answer_testing.framework import data_dir_load

pullrequest.title: Enabling LightRay to accept loaded datasets instead of just filenames

content.raw: It's a bit confusing that it doesn't match argument name from `__init__`. Also it would be nice to switch *dataset* to ```:class:`yt.data_objects.static_output.Dataset` ```
content.html: It's a bit confusing that it doesn't match argument name from __init__. Also it would be nice to switch dataset to :class:`yt.data_objects.static_output.Dataset`

pullrequest.title: Enabling LightRay to accept loaded datasets instead of just filenames

content.raw: Why the class constructor's signature is repeated? See this [link](https://tests.yt-project.org/job/yt_docs/844/artifact/sandbox/doc/build/html/reference/api/generated/yt.analysis_modules.cosmological_observation.light_ray.light_ray.LightRay.html#yt.analysis_modules.cosmological_observation.light_ray.light_ray.LightRay)

pullrequest.title: Enabling LightRay to accept loaded datasets instead of just filenames

content.raw: I think for consistency with previous behavior it should be `self.parameter_filename` which at this point is guaranteed to be a string. Otherwise you could get *dataset* here.
content.html: I think for consistency with previous behavior it should be self.parameter_filename which at this point is guaranteed to be a string. Otherwise you could get dataset here.

pullrequest.title: Enabling LightRay to accept loaded datasets instead of just filenames

content.raw: Same as above, I haven't checked if `simulation()` can handle ds or not though.
content.html: Same as above, I haven't checked if simulation() can handle ds or not though.
